results.title: Sydney Harbour Bridge. Bondi. Sydney Bush. Cars
results.brief_description: A compilation of four experimental films made by filmmaker, Paul Winkler, between 1977 - 1980: “Sydney Harbour Bridge”, “Bondi”, “Sydney Bush” and “Cars”.

results.title: In the shadow of the chimney
results.brief_description: In Melbourne’s densely populated Western suburbs huge chemical, petroleum and manufacturing plants have been built very close to residential areas. Apart from the visual pollution they cause, these plants emit toxic wastes. The level of emissions is loosely regulated and poorly monitored. This video examines the danger posed by these plants, and shows how grass-roots community action can be successful in making both government and industry accountable for the well-being of residents and the environment.

results.title: We call it paradise
results.creator_credit: Australia. Dept. of Defence and Vincent Donovan
results.brief_description: Niree Creed presents this portrait of Garden Island, 6 km. south of Perth and the effect the construction of HMAS Stirling, a naval base, has had on the island and on the town of Rockingham. The construction of the base caused some controversy as squatters, who had lived there for many years, were removed in the process. This film, produced by Defence Public Relations emphasises the benefits the base has brought to the local community.

results.title: Work it out (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A video, aimed at young women between the ages of 14-20 years, that examines career opportunities available. The subject areas covered include : Women at Work; Careers Counselling; Equal Opportunity; Personal Development; Industrial relations; Social Studies.

results.title: Free Climbing
results.brief_description:
Rock climbing is a recreation for some, an obsession for others. “Free Climbing” was filmed at Mt Arapiles and Mt Buffalo and features hair-raising shots as climbers demonstrate safety and technical skills.

Since this work was made (in 1986) there have been significant rediscoveries of indigenous cultural heritage around Mt Arapiles (2019 - 2022). Some of the climbing areas pictured may no longer be accessible due to measures to protect this heritage.

results.title: The Siege of Barton's bathroom
results.brief_description: Elly Barton lives in a barren suburban housing estate where there is only one tree left standing. Now the neighbours want to cut it down, but what no-one seems to understand is that it is Elly’s tree - and she is not going to let anybody touch it. Stars Frankie J. Holden, Max Phipps and Rebekah Elmaloglou.

results.title: Seen one, seen 'em all
results.brief_description: This program looks at media representation of ethnic and minority groups. The video uses a zany quiz show format to raise questions about ethnic stereotyping using examples from advertising. Both the video and its accompanying study guide provide a launching point for classroom discussion, activity and further study, suitable for a wide range of age groups.

results.title: Right... from the start
results.creator_credit: John Julian, Queen Victoria Medical Centre and University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: This videotape is basically for training midwives and medical students and is about the principles of breastfeeding. Mothers are often subject to conflicting views and information about breastfeeding and this video tackles the problem.
